snippet: A former architect working with unconventional materials shuns the elitism of Indian art.
abstract: A former architect working with unconventional materials shuns the elitism of Indian art.
lead_paragraph: “Contemporary Indian art is so disjointed from the public. It’s elitist. I want to connect with the average person in India,” Asim Waqif, a former architect, told Gayatri Rangachari Shah in her article in the Arts Section of The New York Times. Mr. Waqif’s debut European solo show, “Bordel Monstre” (Monstrous Mess), opens at the Palais de Tokyo in Paris on Friday.

headline.main: Indian Artist Looks to Bring Works to the Everyman
